favourites.name: SWEET TOOTH
favourites.description: Put 2 shots Godiva Liquour into a glass, add as much or as little milk as you would like.

favourites.name: AFTER SEX
favourites.description: Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar

favourites.name: NEGRONI
favourites.description: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

favourites.name: GRAND BLUE
favourites.description: Serve in an old fashioned glass.

favourites.name: BOMBAY CASSIS
favourites.description:
Add the Bombay Sapphire, Cr√®me de Cassis and lime juice to a balloon glass and swirl well to mix.

Fill the glass with good quality cubed ice.

Top up with chilled and freshly opened Fever-Tree Ginger Beer.

Gently stir to combine, top with a gently squeezed lime wedge and finish with a fresh ginger slice.

favourites.name: SCOTTISH HIGHLAND LIQUEUR
favourites.description: Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.

favourites.name: RADLER
favourites.description: Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).

favourites.name: BRANDY COBBLER
favourites.description: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the brandy. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

favourites.name: TEQUILA FIZZ
favourites.description: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

favourites.name: FLAMING LAMBORGHINI
favourites.description: Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

favourites.name: THE LAST WORD
favourites.description: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

favourites.name: 69 SPECIAL
favourites.description: Pour 2 oz. gin. Add 4 oz. 7-up. Add Lemon Juice for flavor. If you are weak, top up glass with more 7-Up.

favourites.name: STRAWBERRY SHIVERS
favourites.description: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

favourites.name: TURF COCKTAIL
favourites.description: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

favourites.name: ABBEY MARTINI
favourites.description: Put all ingredients into a shaker and mix, then strain contents into a chilled cocktail glass.

favourites.name: STRAWBERRY DAIQUIRI
favourites.description: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

favourites.name: LONE TREE COOLER
favourites.description: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.

favourites.name: MELYA
favourites.description: Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.

favourites.name: FRENCH CONNECTION
favourites.description: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

favourites.name: COSMOPOLITAN MARTINI
favourites.description: Pour all ingredients in mixing glass half filled with ice, shake and strain into chilled Martini glass.

favourites.name: LASSI - A SOUTH INDIAN DRINK
favourites.description: Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.

favourites.name: SPRITZ VENEZIANO
favourites.description: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

favourites.name: TUXEDO COCKTAIL
favourites.description: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.
